intro: Senecio lilacinus, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying a sprawling or upright growth habit. Its leaves are usually gray-green, with a woolly texture, and its flowers range from blue to purple, adding visual interest to its habitat. Senecio lilacinus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
